title: Count Backwards With a For Loop
content: A for loop can also count backwards, as long as we can define the right conditions
In order to decrement by two each iteration, we'll need to change our initialization, condition, and final expression.
We'll start at i = 10 and loop while i > 0. We'll decrement i by 2 each loop with i -= 2;
ourArray will now contain [10, 8, 6, 4, 2]. Let's change our initialization and final expression so that we can count backwards by twos to create an array of descending odd numbers.
